meanings.definition: A traditional Jewish dessert made of small balls of dough boiled in honey
meanings.sent1: Grandma made delicious teiglach for dessert last night.
meanings.sent2: I can't wait to try the teiglach at the bakery down the street.
meanings.sent3: The teiglach were so sweet, they made my teeth ache!
meanings.sent4: The teiglach glistened like golden pearls in the honey syrup.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the teiglach filled the kitchen, tempting everyone to have a taste.

meanings.definition: A term of endearment or affection for a loved one
meanings.sent1: My dear, you are my sweet teiglach.
meanings.sent2: He always calls her his little teiglach, which makes her smile.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said, 'You're my teiglach, always sticking by my side.'
meanings.sent4: Their love was as warm and comforting as a plate of teiglach on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: In his eyes, she was the most precious teiglach in the world.
